Reviews.Title: “Near station”
Reviews.Author: Kathy S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Handy for station. Traitional building and quaint interior. Computer available. Polite and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: Sharda02
Reviews.Content: We had 3 of us in one room. Very small and sad looking room. Stayed for 2 nights and on e first night they couldnt find e room heater remote control for our room!! Lady at e reception was always on e phone, even when we were doing our payment. Be very alert while walking along e road, near hotel, as I was robbed by a group of gypsi beggars!! E only thing nice abt the hotel was e breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Small and clean boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tinamaxima
Reviews.Content: Very good location,clean hotel,but very bad wi-fi in our room and not enough warm water sometimes when we need

Reviews.Title: “Fine and Handy”
Reviews.Author: Ticasue
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in Nov. 2011. It is rather worn, and could use some cosmetic work, but it was a good location, and clean and quiet. It's about a 7 block walk from Termini......doable if your luggage isn't too heavy. Typical of small hotels, there is not large sign, just the buzzer system, and a small red sign hanging from building. But, the lift worked, the front desk people were very helpful and accomodating, and the clientele of the hotel seemed honorable. The area is a little rough, but my friend and I felt safe coming home at about 11 p.m. It is in a good location to catch the metro for various stops in Rome, or you can walk to Spanish Steps, Trevi, etc. My room had a small twin bed, but it was a quiet room. The breakfast service is nice, people are nice, and all in all, I felt my money was well spent here.

Reviews.Title: “Small but pleasant room”
Reviews.Author: dorafig82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ascot for 5 nights in November 2011, in room 28. The people at the desk were very helpful and friendly, and always spoke to us in near perfect English. We booked a "Double Room" and we ended up getting a room with 2 twin beds pushed together. We were fine with it, but I definitely recommend getting in touch with the hotel ahead of time if this is something that would bother you. The hotel is a bit out of the way, a block behind the Museo Nazionale, but it was LOUD outside. The windows were noise-reducing, which was nice, but there was nothing to keep all the traffic noise out. I am a really light sleeper and still had to use earplugs. My husband, though, slept right through it. There was no heat in the room, but they had additional blankets available which were thick enough to keep sufficiently warm. It was very clean, and fairly quiet inside. This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Piazza Repubblica, 30 minutes from the Spanish Steps, 35 from the Pantheon, and 40 from the Colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient budget location but beds not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Trotamundos09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a bank holiday long weekend. Even though they have a big, red neon sign at the corner, I guarantee you will walk right past the hotel if you are expecting a typical hotel front. It is actually on two floors of a residential building only steps from the corner. (Look for the small plaque on the wall.) During the day, there is an outdoor market on that street that will make finding the place even more difficult. Small elevator to the second floor reception, though my room was on the 1st floor. Helpful Filipino with excellent English at reception when I checked in late one night. Room good size, but single bed very narrow and not very comfortable, like a roll-away folding bed. Bathroom good sized. Quiet, since it faced an interior courtyard, though there was a lot of noise in the stairway beginning early in the morning. Wifi (free) didn't reach this floor so had to go upstairs and sit in the "computer room," really a wide hallway between rooms. All in all, decent budget choice in a convenient location not far from Termini.

Reviews.Title: “It wont break the budget.... and its clean!”
Reviews.Author: wanderingirl23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel the last time i was passing through Rome. It is an good, economically priced option. The hotel is close to termini so there is easy access to the train and metro system and there are a few eating options in the area. I wandered around the area (alone) at all times of the day and night and while it is not the nicest area in Rome, there are a lot of the usual suspects that hang around large train stations all over the world, i certainly didnt feel threatened or unsafe. The hotel is located on via Montebello and the numbers arent in running order so it is just on the left as you turn enter via Montebello...there is a small gold plaque on the wall. Reception is on the second floor. The rooms are a good size, although the bathrooms are pretty smaller...but it is Rome after all! Rooms were clean and had the usual ammenities including free WiFi and breakfast. Desk staff can provide maps and advice on how to get where you need to go The hotel itself is nothing fancy but it is clean, so if you are looking for a hotel that has easy access to Termini and wont break the budget this is a good option. Although for longer stays it may be worth looking at other options i.e. apartment rental in an area that is a bit nicer with more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: Dkcsilla
Reviews.Content: great clean, quiet hotel. We had room nr. 39-1st floor, ..big , nice room, the bathroom also. good location, great staff, ..everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: ducati749girl
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night as i was leaving town the next day but saw three staff members all of whom were accommodating and helpful. I chose it for the good access to Termini, free wifi and 24hr reception (i arrived late at night) and that i could leave my bags there until i was ready to catch the train to the airport later in the evening the next day. The Ascot ticked all those boxes and delivered except that wifi was only available in the lounge on the 2nd floor and my room was on the first floor which at the time was inconvenient. There is a lift from the ground floor so had no problems lugging around my bag. The rooms were reasonable in size, very clean, bed was comfortable (others i have stayed with were very hard) and quiet and i didnt hear any noise from any other guests. Breakfast was good but it wasnt available until 8am and as others have noted that is a bit inconvenient if you want to get out early to do sightseeing. Plenty of restaurants/take aways nearby as well as general shops. Location in terms of sightseeing in Rome is good if you are ok with public transport (the buses are actually very good in Rome), but the Ascot is at the Termini end which means it is a walk across town to the Forum and Colosseum. However this means it is cheaper than being right in the centre of town and i found i got a great deal from an accom website and so it was great value and would consider staying here again for 1 or 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but over priced”
Reviews.Author: HappyStop
Reviews.Content: We had room 25, a corner room with king size bed. Room is very good size, clean, good storage area and desk with TV, Good size shower with plenty of hot water. Windows do shut out the sound from outside, but as noted in other reviews, if your neighbors are loud you will hear them. There is a market almost every morning in the street as you exit the hotel Except for one gentleman who went out of his way to make a copy for me, the desk staff seemed distant and preoccupied with concerns other than their guests. Maybe it is just Roman reserve but I never saw a smile returned in the four days I was there. Once, when I asked if we could eat 15 min earlier, the clerk pointedly looked at the clock and said nothing. Breakfast is not until 8, which is late when you are trying to get out early to avoid the crowds. Often there were people waiting to eat and some just went in and started early and did without the coffee. It is convenient to the train station, Metro and buses. However, I think I could have done better for $180 per night

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: OnceInALongWhile
Reviews.Content: Ascot is located at the intersection of Via Volturno and Via Montebello, close to Repubblica and Termini stations in central Rome. Proximity to Termini is good from a connectivity perspective, and not being in the immediate locality is advantageous considering that Termini is crowded and not entirely safe. Therefore the location of Hotel Ascot is a significant plus in its favour. The hotel lobby itself is on the second floor, and since the door to the main road is always closed, one cannot be blamed for missing it. Keep your eyes wide open and you'll spot the sign on the wall. The room I had was spacious while not opulent. My room did not have a window overlooking the road, but this didn't hurt as the room was large. The restroom was also large (by European standards, anyway!) and well furnished. It appeared that the toilet had actually been redone recently as the fittings seemed to be newer than the rest of the room. The water in the shower pulsated between scalding hot and mildly cold, which was a trifle annoying but tolerable. In some areas (lobby, the door to my room, etc.) there seemed to be a bit of decay but I must add that this did not translate to a lack of cleanliness. The breakfast - included in the tariff - is best missed. There are no fruits, just one fruit juice, and no eggs. Just two options for breads too. Breakfast was the single most disappointing aspect of the hotel - and it was a lot worse than just poor. The people at the front desk were helpful and offer maps upon request. A word on the Wi-Fi - it simply works! I had no trouble logging in, and the speeds were very good - I was able to stream live video on my iPhone. My visit was just after Easter and that probably explains why I had to shell out more than 120 euros for a night. Even so, I feel it is a price too high and I only booked Ascot because I couldn't find a cheaper alternative in as good a location. Under the same circumstances, however, I would still consider booking Ascot in future.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay :)”
Reviews.Author: MiiiiRa
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say .. close to every thing. the staff was very nice and helpful and the rooms were very clean.. We enjoyed our stay :) Remember to ask for the code if you want to use the free wifi :) 10 min away from everything in the center :) I recommend it .. and would definetly come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ascot is an inexpensive,peacefull,convienient place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: ArabSheikh
Reviews.Content: Dear Travellers, I stayed here for four nights from 10th to 14th November 2010. At first it is decieving when you look at the front door, but when you get inside and take the elevator to the floor on which the hotel is located you will feel more reassuring that you made the right decision. We resided in room number 25.Its the best room in the hotel since its close to the reception and breakfast area. Internet speed was super fast and we slept well but I think that was mostly because we we so tired from all the walking tours that we had been doing during our 4 days in Rome. The room faces a street so there could be a lot of traffic in the morning honking and also somedays there is a hawkers market but if you are a person who has well planned your itenary for the day then you would probably get up early and run out of the hotel to catch the train and find the meeting point from where your walking tour actually begins.Breakfast is italian, which include Croissants and cappucino.if you like there are also some other items like tea,cheese,jam,fruit yougurts,toast etc..The hotel is located walking distance to Roma termini, just make sure you have travel bags withe wheels so you can pull it across the road.Also there is a store right across the hotel where you can buy some daily groceries or even some wine and beer.There is also a restaurant across called Baboos that serves italian food. The only problem we had was that the shower in the bathroom did not have a good spray and the water fluctuated from hot to cold ubruptly, but we managed just fine... The Bathroom is very nice and bigger than other bathrooms in other italian hotels, but the shower area is very small which is also like other italian hotels. Overall a really nice place to stay for a short time. Thanks Hotel Ascott and keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: StarWatcher07
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ascot from Sept 24-Sept 28 and had no complaints. There were 4 friends staying here and we had our own clean private room/bath. The breakfast was good, coffee, fresh buns (yum), butter, variety of jams/marmalades, nutella, juice, yogurt, milk, cereal. The location was literally 5 min walk to termini. The area was safe at night we had to fear coming back after midnite. There is a restaurant at the corner right by Ascot called Babu's, fantastic food, ate there a few times. We would stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great location, safe, friendly staff, clean and classy”
Reviews.Author: Jengka7
Reviews.Content: i think this hotel is a family run hotel. and the owner try their best to accomodate us, 24 hour staff (no curfew) but i was annoyed by one of the staff who asking me about why am i going out at 12midnight, what time i will be comeback coz he is watching people come in and out... funny. Yes, you want to taking care of your guest, but dont be like a jail warden because i'am in hotel not in jail. But, its recommended to you to stay here because the place is clean, classy, huge room for two, clean and cosy toilet and great coffee!!! and antique elevator..... so nice. My room number was 28 and situated infront of the computer and wifi router... i love that room.

Reviews.Title: “great value for not too long stay”
Reviews.Author: JulkaR
Reviews.Content: Rome is expensive, so for this price the hotel is perfect ;) Great location if you want to visit Rome for couple of days and don't waste time for getting to the centre by public communication. Rooms are very small and have thin walls but they are clean and air-conditioned. There is even wi-fi internet included in the price. Breakfast is ok - some breadrolls, jam, yoghurts, juice and coffee/tea. It's enough for the hot mornings. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: HonSon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotel Ascot for 3 nights and have to say that we were pleasantly surprised. The rooms are larger than we expected. The furnishings have aged a little, but everything was spotless! Also they clean your room every day. The breakfast was very good. Obviously the choice is limited and mainly sweet, but there was plenty to have including yogurts, juice, cheese and choice of fresh coffee or tea. According to the rest of my family, the coffee was nice. We really appreciated the 24 hour reception and the possibility to keep our luggage there as both of our flights were late at night. The couple running the place was very welcome and helpful. Also the computer with Internet available in the hallway was also handy. The only little drawback is the noise when you get room facing the main street. But when the windows are shut, the isolation is pretty good. However, if you are light sleeper, earplugs might be a good idea. Overall, we can certainly recommend this hotel for your stay in Rome. Beside everything I have mentioned already, the hotel is in good position for the sightseeing and traveling. I think that everything is within walkable distance (Rome is not that big), but if you do not want to walk too much a frequent bus station is right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location and really good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SpanglesLeeds
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Rome to watch Fulham play AS Roma in the Europa Cup. I was only there for two nights and so location was really important as I didn't want to spend ages travelling in and out of the city. The Hotel Ascot is in a fantastic location just a 5 minute walk from Rome Termini - the main Train and Metro station. The directions provided by the hotel are spot on and make it easy to find. The hotel itself is located on the 2nd floor of an apartment block so don't look for a ground floor reception area. When you turn in to the street it is the first door you come to on the right hand side. I stayed in room 22 just behind reception it had 2 single beds a writing desk and a wardrobe - all of which were in good condition. The room itself was clean as was the bathroom, which had a toilet, shower, sink and bidet. Clean towels were provided every day and the beds were made daily as well. Breakfast was continental and included coffee, tea, fresh orange juice. Yoghurts, croissants, cheese, ham, bread, butter and jams. If you are looking for a basic place to stay while you explore the city, in a good location, which offers good value for money then you should definitely stay at the Hotel Ascot.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: JOzeF8
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was clean and the staff went out of their way to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Ok!”
Reviews.Author: doodko
Reviews.Content: A very nice and tipical italian hotel! 2 floors of a residential building. Very clean! Spacious bathroom with bath-tub and shower and bidet. Very good location - a bus stop in front of the hotel, 7-8 min. walking to Piazza della Republica (with U-Station) and the same distance to Termini Station (Central Railway Station). Helpful staff, basic breakfast - coffee, tea,bread, croissant, cheese, youghurt. I definitely recommend the hotel! P.S. To all the american and disappointed guys: this is it - ITALIA - noisy, hurried, cramped... but for 2* hotel it is more than expected!!! If you want something else - pay EUR 200,- for a double room per night and stay away from downtown ;)

Reviews.Title: “A small disappointment”
Reviews.Author: rjsol
Reviews.Content: 2* 5 mins walk from Termini, 20 m down Via Montebello from Via Volturno. Stairs or lift 2 floors up to reception. Vicinity to Volturno gave noisy nights if window open. Definitely not a soft bed, resulted in partly sleepless nights. Room 229 was clean (did not check top of clothes locker) with a shelf, a double bed, a small writing desk halfway occopied by a small TV set, one chair to go with this. A/C centrally operated, high up under the ceiling. Breakfast standard continental juice, milk, youghurt, coffe / tea, croissant, bread, butter, jam, honey + + Reception staff friendly, helpful, accomodative. 3 mins walk to La Famiglia, popular ristorante for tourists and locals, not expensive, 5 mins to Pizzeria da Dinos in Via dei Mille, close to Piazza Indipenza

Reviews.Title: “A fine 2 star option!”
Reviews.Author: Chgoswatcher
Reviews.Content: The Ascot is short, convenient 5 minute walk from Rome's Central Termini Railstation. The Ascot is located in a corner building which can generate some street noise should you be located in a street facing room. There is an elevator in the building and someone is at the reception desk 24/7. I booked a double room (#25) for single use as I dislike sleeping on a narrow twin bed. The room was clean and the bathroom was spotless. While the bathroom was narrow, it was long, about the width of the room, and included an enclosed shower stall, toilet, bidet and sink. A hairdryer was provided. Not lit enough for a woman to do her evening makeup, but enough for me to shave. The room included a double king size bed, 2 bedstands, a work desk and a wardrobe. The tv was tiny, about a 7 inch screen. Air conditioning was present, but not needed or used. Room rates include continental breakfast. The staff was pleasant and helpful. English was spoken.

Reviews.Title: “nice short trip”
Reviews.Author: railtrip
Reviews.Content: We have been in Rome for a short trip with two parents and a teen. The hotel was nice, clean and near some really good restaurants. The service was okay

Reviews.Title: “a few problems”
Reviews.Author: traveler10021
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Ascot last august (2006). At first glance, the hotel and the room looked nice but I started having some problems after that. First, i asked for a room with ac, but when I arrived the guy at the front desk didn't give me the remote control for it. I had to go and asked specially for it, and then the old guy told me that it wasn't necessary because that day wasn't too hot. It was at least 80 degrees and I had been walking with my luggage from the train station so I replied I wanted it anyway. The point is that I never actually understood how the thing work so some days it was fine but other it was too cold. One of the days, the hot water was out and it took a day to get it back. The room was clean the first day but they didn't really clean for the rest of my stay (which was 6 nights). And the old guy never was kind, though the rest of the people at the front desk were really nice. If I have to choose again, I'll stay at least a block closer to the Termini (the last block that you need to walk to get to the hotel is not really nice).

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: stratford27
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located by Termini Station, ideal for exploring Rome on foot and by public transport. Rooms are small, but clean and with very efficient air conditioning - a godsend in baking hot July weather. A cheerful little breakfast room with a pleasant continental breakfast and great coffee. Friendly staff. A character point to note about this hotel. It's sited on the second floor in a traditional Roman apartment block. I loved the atmospheric gloom of the echoing entrance hall and the lift is straight out of a B movie thriller. And I've always wanted to breakfast by a balcony overlooking a traditional Roman street market. A cheerful and fascinating way to start the day. Definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “small and overpriced, but clean”
Reviews.Author: boonyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good locaiton and close walking distance to major sites. However, the room was small and the price too much for what was offered. Also, there were problems with the phone in the room - we couldn't get it to work properly, even after contacting reception - and they recommended a very bad touristy restaurant to us even after we especially asked for a non-touristy one. The price was too high for what we got - but maybe that's just Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay good laocation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I recently stayed in the Hotel Ascot, near Termini. Although the hotel was very basic it was very clean and the staff were friendly and courteous at all times. The shower was excelent, although the towels were a bit wierd (a bit like drying yourself with a table cloth, I would imagine). The only draw back was the noise insulation from within the hotel i.e. the lobby and other rooms was a bit poor. However, the windows provided excelent insulation from the noise of the busy street directly outside. Our room even had a small balcony was provided an ideal spot to people watch from.. All in all, a very good hotel at a very good price (for Rome). I would not have any hesitation to stay there again and would recomend it. Oh, they also looked after our bags before and after we checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: jkcook
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in a room with four twin beds and a private bath for only 105 euros a night including continental breakfast. It was nothing fancy, but very clean, within walking distance of the central train station and metro and buses from Campini airport, and even has an elevator. We had no problem getting anywhere. The desk clerks were all very friendly and helpful. It was even very quiet. A winner!

HotelInfo.Name: Ascot
HotelInfo.Address: Via Montebello 22, 00185 Rome, Italy
